intro: Planchonella australis, commonly known as the Australian native plum, is a small evergreen tree native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible drupes that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
